intro: Chamissoa frondosa, commonly known as the fronded chamissoa, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Chamissoa frondosa is often found in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats. Its foliage and flowers are adapted to withstand drought and full sun exposure.
